bibl.title: Notationes legentis.
bibl.note: Jenokr€tai in P. Oxy. XLII, 3016. - EÈgen°statow. In papyri this honorific epithet does not antedate the Dominate. - Registrations of Status, not Birth. "Declaration of birth" is a misnomer. - On Roman Affinities in Antinoite Status. - Heptanomia Headquarters at Antinoopolis. - Absentee Landlords. P. Oxy. XLVII, 3332 identifies the complainants of P. Oxy. XLIX, 3464 as being domiciled in Oxyrhynchus. - How Impure? About the uncleaned wheat in P. Oxy. LXII, 4343, 2-3. - The Postumus Papyrus. P. Med. Inv. 68.53 [ed.: Carla BALCONI, Rabirio Postumo dioiketes d'Egitto in P. Med. inv. 68.53?, Aegyptus 73 (1993) pp. 4-5, pl.], 1. - Notes on Kellis Papyri. - Mundane Hybris. Frictions with Ïbriw between Egyptians and Greek-speaking settlers. <xenokritai, eugenestatos, hubris>
bibl.seg: 145.4 P. Kellis Gr. I, 21; 30; 38a; 42; 67; 71 P. Med. Inv. 68.53 P. Oxy. XLII, 3016; XLVII, 3332; XLIX, 3464; LXII, 4343
